title: Cannot label videos
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

Any attempts to run `DeepLabCut.create_labeled_video` error. This problem occurs regardless of whether the command is run from iPython or a script. If the command is run from iPython, it also kills iPython. I receive slightly different errors when running in iPython vs as a python script. The error included under `relevant log output` is produced by the script, and the error under `additional information` is from running in iPython. Interestingly, this always occurs exactly 92% of the way into creating the video.

As far as I can tell, the root error is about the numpy index being out of bounds.

### Operating System

operating system RHEL8 (on my University HPC cluster)

### DeepLabCut version

dlc version 2.2.0.6

### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

gpu NVIDIA A-100

### Steps To Reproduce

In a DeepLabCut Conda environment (no gui support):
```python
import deeplabcut as dlc
config_path = "/path/to/config.yaml"
dlc.create_labelled_video(config_path, ['/path/to/video.avi'])
```

### Relevant log output

```shell
"""
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/rbp33/.conda/envs/DEEPLABCUT/lib/python3.8/multiprocessing/pool.py", line 125, in worker
    result = (True, func(*args, **kwds))
  File "/home/rbp33/.conda/envs/DEEPLABCUT/lib/python3.8/multiprocessing/pool.py", line 48, in mapstar
    return list(map(*args))
  File "/home/rbp33/.conda/envs/DEEPLABCUT/lib/python3.8/site-packages/deeplabcut/utils/make_labeled_video.py", line 671, in proc_video
    CreateVideo(
  File "/home/rbp33/.conda/envs/DEEPLABCUT/lib/python3.8/site-packages/deeplabcut/utils/make_labeled_video.py", line 177, in CreateVideo
    clip.save_frame(image)
  File "/home/rbp33/.conda/envs/DEEPLABCUT/lib/python3.8/site-packages/deeplabcut/utils/video_processor.py", line 149, in save_frame
    self.svid.write(np.flip(frame, 2))
  File "<__array_function__ internals>", line 5, in flip
  File "/home/rbp33/.conda/envs/DEEPLABCUT/lib/python3.8/site-packages/numpy/lib/function_base.py", line 236, in flip
    axis = _nx.normalize_axis_tuple(axis, m.ndim)
  File "/home/rbp33/.conda/envs/DEEPLABCUT/lib/python3.8/site-packages/numpy/core/numeric.py", line 1385, in normalize_axis_tuple
    axis = tuple([normalize_axis_index(ax, ndim, argname) for ax in axis])
  File "/home/rbp33/.conda/envs/DEEPLABCUT/lib/python3.8/site-packages/numpy/core/numeric.py", line 1385, in <listcomp>
    axis = tuple([normalize_axis_index(ax, ndim, argname) for ax in axis])
numpy.AxisError: axis 2 is out of bounds for array of dimension 0
"""

The above exception was the direct cause of the following exception:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "scripts/evaluate.py", line 33, in <module>
    dlc.create_labeled_video(
  File "/home/rbp33/.conda/envs/DEEPLABCUT/lib/python3.8/site-packages/deeplabcut/utils/make_labeled_video.py", line 518, in create_labeled_video
    pool.map(func, Videos)
  File "/home/rbp33/.conda/envs/DEEPLABCUT/lib/python3.8/multiprocessing/pool.py", line 364, in map
    return self._map_async(func, iterable, mapstar, chunksize).get()
  File "/home/rbp33/.conda/envs/DEEPLABCUT/lib/python3.8/multiprocessing/pool.py", line 771, in get
    raise self._value
numpy.AxisError: axis 2 is out of bounds for array of dimension 0
```


### Anything else?

I think this is likely related to #1698, but I opened a new error since I can't run this command at all. It seems to independent of any options passed. I've tried with various combinations of `trailingpoints`, `draw_skeleton`, `save_frames`, `filtered`, and others, all producing the same error.

The iPython error is below. Though different than the python script error above, I think the root error is the same.

<details>
  <summary>iPython interactive session error</summary>
  
```python

  File "/home/rbp33/.conda/envs/DEEPLABCUT/lib/python3.8/site-packages/deeplabcut/utils/make_labeled_video.py", line 177, in CreateVideo

numpy.AxisError: axis 2 is out of bounds for array of dimension 0

AssertionError
```

Sorry the attached config is a text file. Github Issues won't allow the uploading of yaml files.

<details>
  <summary>config.yaml</summary>

[config.txt](https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/files/8123143/config.txt)
</details>
